item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 22nd May
item.description:
Customer reporting having had to swerve to avoid hitting large, low-hanging branch still attached to tree. Posing risk to motorcyclists/large vehicles.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly posting on dangerous mini roundabout, 22nd May
item.description:
A housing advertisement has been located here for weeks already. It's also in a very dangerous spot on an extremely busy mini roundabout taking drivers' attention away from their driving.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Bath Road, Cheltenham

item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Undulating road surface, 21st May
item.description:
The surface of this road is in a terrible state, heavily infilled, undulating and extremely hazardous for cyclists.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Victoria Place, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous road surface and no road markings, 21st May
item.description:
The whole of Knapp Road is an accident waiting to happen. The surface of the road is heavily pot holed and undulating. The road markings are pretty much non existent especially near the school entrance with the School lettering on the road almost invisible which could intirn be a danger to children. Hopefully the road can be resurfaced in it's entirety rather than just a quick spray job that seems to be the norm for the Gloucestershire Highways department.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saint James Square, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked Drains, 21st May
item.description:
Several drains are obstructed around the roundabout at the junction of Prestbury Road, Albert Road and Pittville Circus. I reported this same issue around a year ago and as of yet nothing has been done. Today I counted 6 out of 7 drains blocked arohnd the roundabout with some even having plants growing through the grill. Even Prestbury Road that was recently resurfaced is already suffering from pulleys full.of leaf litter...again something that hasn't been resolved following a complaint raised several months ago.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pittville Circus, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Near the corner of Alma Road, 21st May
item.description:
Multiple pot holes on the left hand side of Alma road from Hatherley road. Again, as previously reported, there are many potholes, some smaller than others, which are a danger to cyclists and cars as people are avoiding them and nearly hitting oncoming vehicles. This has been reported, and filled, many times!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Alma Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes outside 64, 21st May
item.description:
This has been reported by myself, and I believe several others, but still nothing has been done! I cannot reiterate how dangerous this is, both to cyclists and cars! This area has many potholes that have been filled many times! Can something please get sorted.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Alma Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Signs heavily faded, 21st May
item.description:
The signs on the M5 (northbound) as you approach J11 are heavily bleached by the sun and are no longer legible. This has been the case for many years and it doesn’t provide clear information for visitors to Gloucester and Cheltenham.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous 60mph speed limit outside a very busy Dunkertons, 21st May
item.description:
National speed limit of 60 mph combined with narrow pavement to Charlton Kings is very dangerous outside very popular and growing entertainment location Dunkertons. The venue is used by young people and families many of whom will be walking along the pavement in the dark. Issue is ongoing and of increasing concern due to Dunkerton’s imminent expansion.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More fly tipping, 21st May
item.description:
Last night a cardboard box and another black bag of rubbish was added to the existing mound of detritus dumped here. That’s 3 dumps of rubbish in the space of 3 days. Why can’t you do something about this???
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Alstone Lane, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned dining chair, 21st May
item.description:
This dining chair has been here for a couple of weeks now, being moved around the electricity substation here. Please can it be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Redthorne Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
